section.title: The Simetron Project
section.p: The Simetron Project is an open source project, sponsored by The Olympum Software Group, that aims at creating a modular traffic simulator for metropolitan networks.
Simetron is designed as an open plugin architecture, written in C#, with multi-platform support via the mono runtime. Simetron consists of the following modules:

ul.li: Workbench - A graphical user interface for monitoring and controlling simulations, analyzing results, and editing networks. [Started]
Microkernel - The small footprint simulation engine based on a distributed workflow engine. [Started]

section.title: Hosted Subprojects
section.p: During the development of Simetron we continously face technical problems, for which we create libraries that have no dependencies with Simetron. You can use these in your project.

ul.li: GtkGL# - A C# library that integrates OpenGL with the Gtk# windowing toolkit.

section.title: Licensing
section.p: Simetron and the simulator modules are released to the community under the terms of the GNU General Public License, to ensure that this software is free and remains free.

The hosted subprojects are released under a BSD license in order to allow the biggest audience to benefit from them. You can use, modify, hack, copy, distribute these libraries in your projects, both open source and proprietary.
If you would like to discuss the license terms, or are interested in obtaining a custom license agreement that suits your business needs, please write to licensing@simetron.org.

section.title: Getting Involved
section.p: Anyone can participate. All interested developers are welcome to join and participate. Bug reports and patches are highly welcome.
